skill.name: repo-docs
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "generate repository documentation", "create a README", "document API", "write architecture docs", "add CONTRIBUTING guide", "update repo docs", "document codebase", or mentions repository documentation, codebase analysis, or cross-repository integration documentation.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "generate repository documentation", "create a READM...
skill.author: AstraBit-CPT

security_audit.summary: Legitimate documentation generation skill with clean security posture. Contains Python scripts that perform safe static analysis (file reading and pattern matching) without executing code or making network calls. All capabilities directly serve the stated documentation purpose.

content.value_statement: Documentation is often outdated or missing in code repositories. This skill analyzes codebase structure and generates comprehensive README, API, architecture, and contributing guides with cross-repository integration awareness.
actual_capabilities: Generate README.md with quick start and integration sections
Create API documentation with endpoints and authentication
Write architecture documentation with system diagrams
Produce CONTRIBUTING guides with development setup
Analyze codebase structure and technology stack
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not modify existing files without explicit user request
Cannot access private repositories without proper credentials
Templates require manual customization for specific projects

use_cases.title: Document Microservice Ecosystems
use_cases.description: Map dependencies between services and generate integration documentation for distributed systems

use_cases.title: Create Project Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate professional README, API docs, and contributing guides for public repositories

use_cases.title: Standardize Documentation
use_cases.description: Apply consistent documentation templates across multiple repositories in an organization

prompt_templates.title: Basic README
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a README.md for this repository. Include project description, quick start instructions, usage examples, and integration points with other repositories.

prompt_templates.title: API Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create API.md documentation for this project. List all endpoints with request/response examples, authentication requirements, and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate ARCHITECTURE.md for this repository. Include system overview, component diagram, cross-repository dependencies, and data flow between services.

prompt_templates.title: Contributing Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate CONTRIBUTING.md with development setup steps, testing instructions, code style guidelines, and links to related repositories.

output: - Quick start with installation and running commands

best_practices: Run the skill on a clean checkout to ensure examples match current code
Review and customize templates before committing generated documentation
Update documentation when adding new integrations or changing architecture
anti_patterns: Expecting the skill to execute code or run tests automatically
Using generated documentation without verifying accuracy
Ignoring cross-repository integration points in the documentation

faq.question: What languages and frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Ruby, C#, PHP, and their frameworks like React, Django, FastAPI, Spring Boot, and Gin.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my existing files?
faq.answer: The skill generates documentation templates. It only writes files when explicitly requested using the Write tool with user approval.

faq.question: How does it find integration points between repositories?
faq.answer: Python scripts analyze code for patterns like npm scoped packages, Go module imports, Python internal imports, and HTTP client usage to identify cross-repository dependencies.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads repository files locally and outputs to stdout. No data is sent to external services or stored beyond the current session.

faq.question: Why is my documentation missing some features?
faq.answer: The skill generates documentation based on actual code patterns found. If features are not detected, you may need to manually add sections or customize the templates.

faq.question: How does this compare to other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses AI to understand context and generate integrated documentation. Unlike static generators, it can map cross-repository dependencies and adapt to different codebases automatically.
